briefdescription.para: Start a new sftp session.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh session to use.

simplesect.para: A new sftp session or NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Start a new sftp session with an existing channel.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh session to use.
An open session channel with subsystem already allocated

simplesect.para: A new sftp session or NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Create a new sftp server session.

parameterdescription.para: The ssh session to use.
The ssh channel to use.

simplesect.para: A new sftp server session.

briefdescription.para: Intialize the sftp server.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session to init.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Close and deallocate a sftp session.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle to free.

briefdescription.para: Get the last sftp error.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to get the latest error set by a posix like sftp function.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session where the error is saved.

simplesect.para: The saved error (see server responses), < 0 if an error in the function occured.
Server responses

briefdescription.para: Initialize the sftp session with the server.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session to initialize.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh error set.

briefdescription.para: Get the count of extensions provided by the server.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session to use.

simplesect.para: The count of extensions provided by the server, 0 on error or not available.

briefdescription.para: Get the name of the extension provided by the server.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session to use.
The index number of the extension name you want.

simplesect.para: The name of the extension.

briefdescription.para: Get the data of the extension provided by the server.

detaileddescription.para: This is normally the version number of the extension.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session to use.
The index number of the extension data you want.

simplesect.para: The data of the extension.

briefdescription.para: Check if the given extension is supported.

detaileddescription.para:
sftp
The sftp session to use.
name
The name of the extension.
data
The data of the extension.
1 if supported, 0 if not. Example:

briefdescription.para: Open a directory used to obtain directory entries.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle to open the directory.
The path of the directory to open.

simplesect.para: A sftp directory handle or NULL on error with ssh and sftp error set.

briefdescription.para: Get the version of the SFTP protocol supported by the server.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle.

simplesect.para: The server version.

briefdescription.para: Get a single file attributes structure of a directory.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle to read the directory entry.
The opened sftp directory handle to read from.

simplesect.para: A file attribute structure or NULL at the end of the directory.
sftp_attribute_free()

briefdescription.para: Tell if the directory has reached EOF (End Of File).

parameterdescription.para: The sftp directory handle.

simplesect.para: 1 if the directory is EOF, 0 if not.

briefdescription.para: Free a sftp attribute structure.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp attribute structure to free.

briefdescription.para: Close an open file handle.

parameterdescription.para: The open sftp file handle to close.

simplesect.para: Returns SSH_NO_ERROR or SSH_ERROR if an error occured.

briefdescription.para: Close a directory handle opened by sftp_opendir().

parameterdescription.para: The sftp directory handle to close.

simplesect.para: Returns SSH_NO_ERROR or SSH_ERROR if an error occured.

memberdef.argsstring: (sftp_session sftp, const char *file, int flags, mode_t mode)
memberdef.name: sftp_open

briefdescription.para: Open a file on the server.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle.
The file to be opened.

Is one of O_RDONLY, O_WRONLY or O_RDWR which request opening the file read-only,write-only or read/write. Acesss may also be bitwise-or'd with one or more of the following: O_CREAT - If the file does not exist it will be created. O_EXCL - When used with O_CREAT, if the file already exists it is an error and the open will fail. O_TRUNC - If the file already exists it will be truncated.
Mode specifies the permissions to use if a new file is created. It is modified by the process's umask in the usual way: The permissions of the created file are (mode & ~umask)

simplesect.para: A sftp file handle, NULL on error with ssh and sftp error set.

briefdescription.para: Make the sftp communication for this file handle non blocking.

parameterdescription.para: The file handle to set non blocking.

briefdescription.para: Make the sftp communication for this file handle blocking.

parameterdescription.para: The file handle to set blocking.

briefdescription.para: Read from a file using an opened sftp file handle.

parameterdescription.para: The opened sftp file handle to be read from.
Pointer to buffer to recieve read data.
Size of the buffer in bytes.

simplesect.para: Number of bytes written, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

briefdescription.para: Start an asynchronous read from a file using an opened sftp file handle.

detaileddescription.para: Its goal is to avoid the slowdowns related to the request/response pattern of a synchronous read. To do so, you must call 2 functions:
The first step is to call sftp_async_read_begin(). This function returns a request identifier. The second step is to call sftp_async_read() using the returned identifier.

parameterdescription.para: The opened sftp file handle to be read from.
Size to read in bytes.

simplesect.para: An identifier corresponding to the sent request, < 0 on error.
When calling this function, the internal offset is updated corresponding to the len parameter.

A call to sftp_async_read_begin() sends a request to the server. When the server answers, libssh allocates memory to store it until sftp_async_read() is called. Not calling sftp_async_read() will lead to memory leaks.

memberdef.argsstring: (sftp_file file, void *data, uint32_t size, uint32_t id)
memberdef.name: sftp_async_read

briefdescription.para: Wait for an asynchronous read to complete and save the data.

parameterdescription.para: The opened sftp file handle to be read from.
Pointer to buffer to recieve read data.
Size of the buffer in bytes. It should be bigger or equal to the length parameter of the sftp_async_read_begin() call.
The identifier returned by the sftp_async_read_begin() function.

simplesect.para: Number of bytes read, 0 on EOF, SSH_ERROR if an error occured, SSH_AGAIN if the file is opened in nonblocking mode and the request hasn't been executed yet.
A call to this function with an invalid identifier will never return.

briefdescription.para: Write to a file using an opened sftp file handle.

parameterdescription.para: Open sftp file handle to write to.
Pointer to buffer to write data.
Size of buffer in bytes.

simplesect.para: Number of bytes written, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

briefdescription.para: Seek to a specific location in a file.

parameterdescription.para: Open sftp file handle to seek in.
Offset in bytes to seek.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Seek to a specific location in a file.

parameterdescription.para: Open sftp file handle to seek in.
Offset in bytes to seek.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Report current byte position in file.

parameterdescription.para: Open sftp file handle.

simplesect.para: The offset of the current byte relative to the beginning of the file associated with the file descriptor. < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Report current byte position in file.

parameterdescription.para: Open sftp file handle.

simplesect.para: The offset of the current byte relative to the beginning of the file associated with the file descriptor. < 0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Rewinds the position of the file pointer to the beginning of the file.

parameterdescription.para: Open sftp file handle.

briefdescription.para: Unlink (delete) a file.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle.
The file to unlink/delete.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

briefdescription.para: Remove a directoy.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle.
The directory to remove.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

briefdescription.para: Create a directory.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle.
The directory to create.
Specifies the permissions to use. It is modified by the process's umask in the usual way: The permissions of the created file are (mode & ~umask)

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

briefdescription.para: Rename or move a file or directory.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle.
The original url (source url) of file or directory to be moved.
The new url (destination url) of the file or directory after the move.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

briefdescription.para: Set file attributes on a file, directory or symbolic link.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle.
The file which attributes should be changed.
The file attributes structure with the attributes set which should be changed.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

memberdef.argsstring: (sftp_session sftp, const char *file, uid_t owner, gid_t group)
memberdef.name: sftp_chown

briefdescription.para: Change the file owner and group.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle.
The file which owner and group should be changed.
The new owner which should be set.
The new group which should be set.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

briefdescription.para: Change permissions of a file.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle.
The file which owner and group should be changed.
Specifies the permissions to use. It is modified by the process's umask in the usual way: The permissions of the created file are (mode & ~umask)

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

memberdef.argsstring: (sftp_session sftp, const char *file, const struct timeval *times)

The file which owner and group should be changed.
A timeval structure which contains the desired access and modification time.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, < 0 on error with ssh and sftp error set.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle.
Specifies the path name of the symlink to be read.

The pathname of any file within the mounted file system.

parameterdescription.para: An opened file.

simplesect.para: A statvfs structure or NULL on error.

The path to be canonicalized.

briefdescription.para: Get information about a file or directory.

The path to the file or directory to obtain the information.

briefdescription.para: Get information about a file or directory.

detaileddescription.para: Identical to sftp_stat, but if the file or directory is a symbolic link, then the link itself is stated, not the file that it refers to.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp session handle.
The path to the file or directory to obtain the information.

simplesect.para: The sftp attributes structure of the file or directory, NULL on error with ssh and sftp error set.

briefdescription.para: Get information about a file or directory from a file handle.

parameterdescription.para: The sftp file handle to get the stat information.

simplesect.para: The sftp attributes structure of the file or directory, NULL on error with ssh and sftp error set.
